actions.committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Labor and Human Resources.

actions.in_committee: Committee on Labor and Human Resources
actions.text: Committee on Labor and Human Resources requested executive comment from Office of Management and Budget and National Science Foundation.

official_title: A bill to establish the Congressional Scholarships for Science, Mathematics, and Engineering, and for other purposes.
short_title: Congressional Scholarships for Science, Mathematics, and Engineering Act

summary.text: Congressional Scholarships for Science, Mathematics, and Engineering Act - Instructs the Director of the National Science Foundation (NSF) to establish and implement a merit-based competitive program for awarding a four-year Congressional Scholarship for Science, Mathematics, and Engineering to one female and one male from each U.S. congressional district. Requires the Director: (1) annually to notify secondary schools and colleges of the program; and (2) to establish nominating committees for each congressional district. Limits each scholarship to $5,000 per year, to be used solely for tuition, fees, and room and board expenses. Requires the NSF Director to ensure that both students and nominating committees are selected on a nondiscriminatory basis. Authorizes appropriations for FY 1989 through 1992.

titles.title: Congressional Scholarships for Science, Mathematics, and Engineering Act
A bill to establish the Congressional Scholarships for Science, Mathematics, and Engineering, and for other purposes.
